class.name: MixerProvider
class.javadoc:
A provider or factory for a particular mixer type. This mechanism allows the implementation to determine how resources are managed in creation / management of a mixer.
Kara Kytle
1.3

Indicates whether the mixer provider supports the mixer represented by the specified mixer info object.

The full set of mixer info objects that represent the mixers supported by this {@code MixerProvider} may be obtained through the {@code getMixerInfo} method. info an info object that describes the mixer for which support is queried {@code true} if the specified mixer is supported, otherwise {@code false} #getMixerInfo()

Obtains the set of info objects representing the mixer or mixers provided by this MixerProvider.

The {@code isMixerSupported} method returns {@code true}for all the info objects returned by this method. The corresponding mixer instances for the info objects are returned by the {@code getMixer} method. a set of mixer info objects #getMixer(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer.Info) getMixer(Mixer.Info) #isMixerSupported(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer.Info) isMixerSupported(Mixer.Info)

Obtains an instance of the mixer represented by the info object.

The full set of the mixer info objects that represent the mixers supported by this {@code MixerProvider} may be obtained through the {@code getMixerInfo} method. Use the {@code isMixerSupported} method to test whether this {@code MixerProvider} supports a particular mixer. info an info object that describes the desired mixer mixer instance IllegalArgumentException if the info object specified does not match the info object for a mixer supported by this MixerProvider. #getMixerInfo() #isMixerSupported(javax.sound.sampled.Mixer.Info) isMixerSupported(Mixer.Info)
